channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Biden Is Expected to Sign Order Letting Him Seal Border With Mexico
item.description: The move, expected on Tuesday, would allow the president to temporarily close the border and suspend longtime protections for asylum seekers in the United States.

item.title: Israel’s Seizure of Gaza Border Zone Strains Ties With Egypt
item.description: Israel defied ominous Egyptian warnings and took control of the Philadelphi Corridor, but the reaction from Egypt, which wants to maintain its security cooperation with Israel, has been muted.

item.title: Corporate America is making tons of easy money just by parking piles of cash and watching it grow
item.description: Interest income reaped by non-financial companies on the S&P 500 jumped about 60% in the first quarter.

item.title: Israel’s Seizure of Gaza Border Zone Strains Ties With Egypt
item.description: Israel defied ominous Egyptian warnings and took control of the Philadelphi Corridor, but the reaction from Egypt, which wants to maintain its security cooperation with Israel, has been muted.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Israel’s Military Says 4 More Hostages in Gaza Are Dead, Killed Months Ago
item.description: All four had been kidnapped from kibbutzes on Oct. 7, officials said, and are believed to have been killed in southern Gaza months ago.

item.title: Outer Banks homes are collapsing due to climate change, but coastal property values are booming anyway
item.description: Oceanfront property markets are ignoring the threat of rising sea levels: “A view of the ocean is more desirable.”

item.title: Family Turns Out to Support Hunter Biden as Gun Trial Begins
item.description: The president’s son is on trial in Wilmington, Del., on three charges that he lied about his drug use on a federal firearms application in 2018. The unusual prosecution carries stiff penalties: up to 25 years in prison and a $750,000 fine.

item.title: Voters Turn Mexico’s Governing Party Into the Dominant Party
item.description: Expectations were high for the leftist Morena party, and it exceeded them, potentially giving President-elect Claudia Sheinbaum and her allies the power to enact systemic change.

item.title: 'Orbiting' is the latest dating nightmare fueling Gen Z's disillusionment with finding love on the apps
item.description: Tracking someone’s activity can activate a high-low doom loop that obsesses people.

item.title: Feeling Consumers’ Pain, Retailers Bring Back Discounts
item.description: The pandemic shopping boom led many stores and brands to widen profit margins by charging more. Now value is the watchword as shoppers grow choosier.

item.title: Brazil’s Deadly Flooding Made Twice as Likely by Global Warming, Study Finds
item.description: The country’s south received three months’ rain in two weeks. Global warming has made such deluges twice as likely as before, scientists said.

item.title: Chipotle CEO reveals his go-to order and biggest challenge of working behind the counter
item.description: Brian Niccol developed a newfound appreciation for the fast-casual chain’s ingredients and preparation after completing behind-the-counter training when he became CEO in 2018.

item.title: Mexico Joins List of Latin American Nations That Have Elected Female Presidents
item.description: In contrast to the United States, the region has had more than a dozen female leaders, many in democracies that were once under the sway of authoritarian governments.

item.title: Mexico Joins List of Latin American Nations That Have Elected Female Presidents
item.description: In contrast to the United States, the region has had more than a dozen female leaders, many in democracies that were once under the sway of authoritarian governments.

item.title: Airbnb CEO reflects on fumbled messaging during layoffs: “You don’t fire members of your family”
item.description: CEO Brian Chesky reflects on his comments about feeling "love" for laid-off workers.
